tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Harden to Schenker, dated November 9, 1893

tei:transcription.tei:p: {recto} [preprinted form with handwritten address information] Deutsche Reichspost Postkarte
An [/] Herrn Dr. H. Schenker in Wien Wohnung III Fraungasse 1.
{verso} [printed header with handwritten date inserted] HERAUSGEBER: [–] BERLIN W. 9. 29.9 93 MAXIMILIAN HARDEN [–] DIE ZUKUNFT [–] 27 KÖTHENER STRASSE. [decorated printed rule]

hoffentlich sind Sie wieder ganz wohl. Die „Dirigenten“ This would eventually be published as “Konzertdirigenten” in Die Zukunft on April 14, 1894. It is reprinted in Hellmut Federhofer, Heinrich Schenker als Essayist und Kritiker (Hildesheim: Georg Olms Verlag, 1990), pp. 75-82. sind auch ohne Levi Hermann Levi (1839-1900), a prominent conductor and a major figure in the Brahms-Wagner controversy, switched his alliance from Brahms to Wagner when he accepted the position of Ludwig II’s Hofkapellmeister at Munich in 1872. He eventually directed the first performance of Parsifal in 1882. The meaning of this sentence seems to be that omitting mention of Levi in the projected article is acceptable to Harden. wohlkommen [sic]. Ebenso Virtuosenthum und Erziehung. This seems to be another projected article that did not find its way into Die Zukunft. Perhaps it became “Zur musikalischen Erziehung,” (“On Musical Education”) which appeared in Die Zeit in 1895, and is reprinted in Hellmut Federhofer, Heinrich Schenker als Essayist und Kritiker (Hildesheim: Georg Olms Verlag, 1990), pp. 154-66.
Mit herzlichen Wünschen Ihr ergebener [signed:] Harden

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Harden to Schenker, dated November 9, 1893

tei:translation.tei:p: {recto} [preprinted form with handwritten address information] German Imperial Post Postcard
To Dr. H. Schenker in Vienna Address III Fraungasse 1.
{verso} [printed header with handwritten date inserted] EDITOR: [–] BERLIN W. 9. November 9, 93 MAXIMILIAN HARDEN [–] DIE ZUKUNFT [–] 27 KÖTHENER STRASSE. [decorated printed rule]
I hope you are quite well again. The “Conductors” will be welcome even without Levi. So too Virtuosity and Education.
With cordial wishes, Yours truly, [signed:] Harden
